titles.title: Making further continuing appropriations for fiscal year 2011, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Appropriations.

Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 1776 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 105 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments. All points of order against consideration of the joint resolution are waived except those arising under clause 10 of rule XXI.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1776.

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 105 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments. All points of order against consideration of the joint resolution are waived except those arising under clause 10 of rule XXI.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.J. Res. 105.

vote.text: On passage Passed by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 12/18/2010--Public Law. Amends the Continuing Appropriations Act, 2011 (P.L. 111-242) to extend through December 21, 2010, specified continuing appropriations for FY2011.
